intro: Pentacalia albotecta, commonly known as the white-veined pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are simple and opposite, with a smooth texture and a pale green color. The flowers are usually white or pale blue, with prominent veins that give it its common name.
